div.head: Encoding
div.p: All of our documents are encoded according to TEI P5 standards.

div.head: Processing
div.p: All of our processing relies on open-source and open-access technologies. We follow the Endings Principles for Digital Longeveity, and thus all of our pages are built statically, which means that there is no dependence on server side processing.

div.head: Search
div.p: The search functionality is a prototype, which stems from ongoing work by Martin Holmes and Joey Takeda. This is a fully functional, Javascript-only search engine, built using pre-built indexes of all of the documents. We use the Porter Stemmer (1980) algorithm for word stemming; our indexes are created via a custom XSLT (which can be found on Github) and all input tokens are stemmed using a small Javascript library written by [[GET NAME HERE]].

div.head: Documentation
div.p: All of the encoding documentation for the WEA can be found here.
The Winnifred Eaton Archive is comprised entirely of Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) P5 conformant XML documents.
